basics.name: Ryan Hightower
basics.label: Software Engineer / FrontEnd Developer
basics.summary: Husband, Father of Four, Javascript Engineer, UX/Product Developer, Yogi, and Maker.

highlights: Radically changed our product direction after leading the senior management team in our first successful Design Sprint.
Led customer research and development to identify customer pain points and opportunities.
35% of active customers would be "Very Disappointed" if our product was no longer available. 60% "Somewhat Disappointed"
Worked closely with product, design and marketing officers to guide the development process and ensure priorities were met.
Architected and led the team in building Node.js and Firebase serverless API backends to support our products.

Successfully launched 8 front-end applications: iOS and Android apps; a web-based client-side application; AppleTV, Roku, and FireTV HTML5 Apps for TV; an internal application for product fulfillment; and an automated pipeline for creating custom DVDs.
Cultivated a culture of high-quality code through peer reviews and 85% automated test coverage.
Fostered team growth and unity through 1-on-1 sessions with team members.
As part of the executive team, contributed to the overall vision and strategy of the company.
Proposed and Led the executive team in a Google Design Sprint that led to the success of our last company pivot.
Championed the use of user interviews and user testing to find product-market fit and prioritize value to customers.
Worked closely with UX designers to imagine animations, engaging interactions and intuitive visualizations of data.
Built sophisticated dashboard interfaces for school administrators to measure student success and identify areas for improvement.
Worked with forntend technologies Angular 1.6 and D3.
Led and reported for a team of cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product analysts as Scrum master.

work.summary: Successfully worked in both frontend and backend environments to build full-stack applications to support Starfall's grown-up customers and business operations.
highlights: Built from top to bottom a fully functional e-commerce application to support the sales of their physical products.
Integrated the e-commerce application with the Starfall legacy membership system to support selling digital memberships.
Worked with stakeholders to plan, design, and optimize the e-commerce user experience.
Designed and built backend administration tools to manage e-commerce data and orders.
Designed RESTful APIs to consume e-commerce data in other parts of the Starfall ecosystem.
Built user interfaces in AngularJs and VueJs frameworks.

work.summary: Taught DevPoint Labs' first ever training course on JavaScript FrontEnd Development.
highlights: Developed the curriculum schedule for the course.
Took 11 students from 0 JavaScript knowledge to using canvas and building rudimentary Angular applications.
Taught supporting HTML and CSS skills including css animation and transitions.

work.summary: Guided the digital agency web department in the design and development of client websites.
highlights: Managed a team of designers and developers handling between 5 to 10 projects at a time.
Contributed to the project during planning, design, and development with feedback and ideas for improvement and the team's use of best practices.
Identified project objectives and guided development to meet those objectives.
Managed client expectations while still listening to client feedback to ensure client satisfaction.
Conducted project meetings to facilitate collaboration between clients and the team.
Managed the hiring and firing of team members.

volunteer.summary: Assisted the Board with planning and executing monthly entrepreneurial events.
highlights: Setup and executed email marketing campaigns through Mail Chimp to increase RSVP and event attendance.
Produced a special tribute for Stephen Covey for his induction to the UVEF Hall of Fame. https://vimeo.com/7656246
